citations.narrative:
The walls of the indoor portion of a sheltered housing facility are not impervious to moisture. A juvenile male beagle is
being housed in the "whelping building" with indoor-outdoor access. The walls of his enclosure are made of unsealed,
unpainted, uncovered chip-board. Chip-board is not impervious to moisture and as a rough surface, can easily catch and
absorb water and bodily fluids and cannot be properly sanitized. The unsanitized chip-board can develop mold and
mildew and harbor disease causing bacteria and viruses. All indoor areas of the housing structure that the dogs come into
contact with, such as the floor, walls, den, whelping box, etc, must be impervious to moisture so that they may be
adequately sanitized. Correct by 5/5/23

There is no provision in the program of vet care for the sampling and treatment of heartworm disease. No animals are
being regularly tested for heartworm disease. Heartworm disease can be deadly if left undiagnosed and untreated. It is
important that the written program of vet care accurately reflect and direct the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of
disease and injury of animals at licensed facilities. Correct by assuring that the program of vet care includes sampling and
treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Correct by 5/5/23
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.3(e)(1)(iii) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
The walls of the indoor portion of a sheltered housing facility are not impervious to moisture. A juvenile male beagle is 
being housed in the "whelping building" with indoor-outdoor access. The walls of his enclosure are made of unsealed, 
unpainted, uncovered chip-board. Chip-board is not impervious to moisture and as a rough surface, can easily catch and 
absorb water and bodily fluids and cannot be properly sanitized. The unsanitized chip-board can develop mold and 
mildew and harbor disease causing bacteria and viruses. All indoor areas of the housing structure that the dogs come into 
contact with, such as the floor, walls, den, whelping box, etc, must be impervious to moisture so that they may be 
adequately sanitized. Correct by 5/5/23 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There is no provision in the program of vet care for the sampling and treatment of heartworm disease. No animals are 
being regularly tested for heartworm disease. Heartworm disease can be deadly if left undiagnosed and untreated. It is 
important that the written program of vet care accurately reflect and direct the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of 
disease and injury of animals at licensed facilities. Correct by assuring that the program of vet care includes sampling and

treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in accordance with a 
schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Correct by 5/5/23 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
